summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's legal defense. Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim notifies the government of alleged third-party interference with a secure Webex line used for confidential attorney-client communications, witnessed by an MDC staff member. The email references a court order from August 25th and disputes prior government and MDC assurances about the security of these communications.

persons.name: Nicole McFarland
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email chain regarding interference with Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney-client communications.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney who is writing to complain about interference with secure Webex communications between Maxwell and her counsel, witnessed by an MDC staff member.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Appears as a carbon copy (Cc) recipient on the email, with an email address from the law firm Cohen Gresser.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant who observed suspicious activity on the VTC monitor during a confidential communication session with her counsel and alerted MDC staff.

connections.description: Sternheim is Maxwell's defense attorney, communicating about interference with their privileged communications.
Sternheim is corresponding with Everdell, likely a legal counterpart (e.g., prosecutor or opposing counsel), regarding a court matter.
Sternheim is corresponding with McFarland, likely a legal counterpart (e.g., prosecutor or court staff), regarding a court matter.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: The Court issued an order (referenced in the email) concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's communications with counsel.

events.title: Suspicious VTC Activity Observed
events.description: At the conclusion of an afternoon VTC session, Ghislaine Maxwell observed suspicious activity on the monitor and alerted MDC staff. An MDC Case Manager witnessed the activity.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney alleges new, witnessed interference with the secure Webex line used for attorney-client privileged communications.
An MDC staff member (Case Manager) witnessed the suspicious activity on the VTC monitor, contradicting prior MDC and Government assurances.
The communication references a prior Court order from August 25, 2021, and disputes findings that communication difficulties had been resolved.
The defense is demanding an explanation and evidence of remediation before reporting the issue to the Court.
